page.title: 14Museum Visit.
page.content: On 21st May, 1985, two excited classes came rushing into school. Today they were going on a trip to St Fagans Folk Museum. Mr Mantle and Mr Burns, the two classes' teachers had told them to bring a packed lunch. They set off at 9:45 a.m. and joyfully walked out of the school gates and very quickly ascended to the top of the hill. Then they slowly paraded down hill. At the bottom of the slope they were a few paces away from a water-tower. The two classes ran happily into Coed-Bychan, which was a couple of yards from the water-tower. They saw a variety of trees, mostly beech, before arriving at St Fagans village. They stopped to view St Mary's Church before approaching the Welsh Folk Museum.
